title: Caravan no. 86
testimonial: For me, the caravan meant a lot of satisfaction, fulfillment and challenges. I am extremely pleased to have participated.</br>Dorina Rudișteanu MD, ob-gyn resident

title: Caravan no. 78
testimonial: In Motoșeni I had the feeling that all the sacrifices we make to become doctors have a purpose. I'm happy to have been able to help with a simple EKG or a piece of advice. The Caravan, seen through the eyes of a second year med student, is not only a volunteering opportunity but also a close group of doctors and students who do their best for a small community where access to medical services is poor.</br>Mălina Epure, Caravana cu Medici Iași volunteer

title: Caravan no. 77
testimonial:
Everything happened so fast and it was only at the end of the day that I realized I was no longer feeling my feet. Some children had a visual acuity 0.3 or 0.4 and had never been to an ophthalmology consultation. In the Caravan they were able to receive a prescription and some guidance.
I would gladly return to the Caravan!

title: Caravan no. 75
testimonial: For me, Saturday was an opportunity to really know why I opted for this university. I've discovered that besides studying there is also the pride you feel after you've helped someone in need. The patients left with a diagnosis, but I left with new personal values which I couldn't attain other than by participating in this volunteering experience.

title: Caravan no. 74
testimonial: Thank you! We, the PetroMed team, are proud to have partnered up with you last weekend in Valea Mare! Working together, we better understood the actual value of your project, which is a great example of volunteering and medical service for disadvataged communities!
